newsitem.title: USA: Urban Outfitters sees Q3 below estimates.
newsitem.headline: Urban Outfitters sees Q3 below estimates.

text.p: Urban Outfitters Inc said late Monday third-quarter earnings per share would likely fall $0.01 to $0.03 a share short of analysts' estimates.
The retailer made the announcement after regular Nasdaq trading. Earlier, the stock dropped 2-1/4 to 17-5/8.
The First Call consensus earnings estimate for Urban Outfitters is $0.29 a share, compared with $0.24 a share in the third quarter of last year.
The company said it expected third-quarter earnings to exceed its year-earlier profit.

Urban Outfitters said its earnings in the most recent period would reflect lower-than-expected comparable-store sales during the back-to-school period, particularly in October, and delays in opening new Urban Retail stores.
With two Urban Retail stores set to open in December and holiday merchandise arriving, fourth-quarter earnings should meet current analysts' expectations, the comany said.
